result.execSummary:
The defendant Larry Bishop was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs [Modifiers: Second and Subsequent Offense], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Court ordered defendant to pay costs and victim/witness surcharges by 1/15/2017; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.Court ordered defendant to provide a DNA sample and pay the related surcharge by 1/15/2017; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.

Consecutive to: To any other sentence, with credit for 3 days time served.
Huber privileges for work/AODA/child care pursuant to Sec. 303.08 Wis Stats to apply.
Court is NOT suspending defendant's drivers license.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms or body armor; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Larry Bishop

records.addlTxt: Justice Point Report.
Clerk spoke with Atty. Washington who is unavsilsble on 12/30. Case rescheduled for sentencing on 1/15/215 at 8: 30 am. sab

Exhibits received and inventoried this date.  
Box 641
cf

Defendant Larry Bishop in court with attorney Hazel Jean Washington.  Nathaniel Emery Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
  Defendant  advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.   Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant is advised he is a convicted felon and may not possess any firearms; also defendant is advised he is unable to vote in any election until his/her civil rights are restored. Case calendared for SENTENCING on 12/30/2014 at 8:30 am in Branch 15.

Defendant Larry Bishop in court with attorney Hazel Jean Washington.  Nathaniel Emery Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. /SAB
Matter in Court on defense Motion to Suppress.
Sworn for the State: Officer Matthew Tracy. Exhibits #1, #2 received. State rests. Sworn for the Defense: Larry Bishop, defendant. Exhibit #3 received. Defense rests. After hearing testimony and argument from both parties, Court denies the motion for all the reasons stated on the record. Case calendared for PROJECTED PLEA on 10/23/2014 at 1:30 pm in Branch 15.
Justice Point Report received and filed. sab
State's response to the defendant's Motion to Suppress, received and filed. sab
to Suppress, received and filed. sab

Defendant Larry Bishop in court with attorney Hazel Jean Washington.  Nathaniel Emery Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Deputy Court Clerk:  ss

Defense request for a motion hearing date is granted by the court.  Defense is to file motions by 08-22-14 IN Branch 15 and state is to reply by 09-05-14.  Case is adjourned for motion hearing in Branch 15.  Motion hearing scheduled for 09-19-2014 at 08:30 am.

Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Stark.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Watts, Br. 15.  Scheduling conference scheduled for 8-8-14, 8:30 in Br. 15.

Defendant Larry Bishop in court with attorney Hazel J Washington.  Danielle E Chojnacki appeared for the State of Wisconsin (for ADA Kolberg).  Parties advised that effective 8-3-14, case will be reassigned to Judge Stark, Br. 17, in room 313 of the safety building.  Motion hearing scheduled for August 28, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant Larry Bishop in court with attorney Hazel J Washington.  Hanna R Kolberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 3, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Public Defender's Office called the court to inform the court that the Defendant does qualify for public defender representation. However, the Defendant refuses public defender representation, and indicated he will be retaining counsel for the next court date scheduled for Status of Counsel in Branch 26.

Defendant Larry Bishop in court with attorney Christopher S Carson.  Hanna R Kolberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Motion of the defense counsel to withdraw granted by the Court.
Attorney Christopher Carson to notify the Public Defender's office.  Status conference scheduled for June 19, 2014 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Larry Bishop in court with attorney Christopher S Carson.  Hanna R Kolberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Deputy Court Clerk: alp  Court in jury trial this date; case rescheduled.  Hearing scheduled for 06-09-2014 at 08:30 am.
Defense withdraws the Motion to Suppress. Letter received, signed, and filed with court.

Filed by the defense:  Motion to Suppress Evidence.
Defendant Larry Bishop in court with attorney Christopher Carson.  Hanna R. Kolberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Motion hearing scheduled for June 3, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Larry Bishop in court with attorney Reyna Ivonne Morales.  William Berens, student intern under the supervision of Hanna Kolberg for Antonella Aleman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge William Pocan, Branch 26.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pleads not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 8, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Filed, Justice Point Pretrial Report dated 3/26/14.
css

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.  No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription taken in the manner and fashion as prescribed.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Larry Bishop in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Defendant Larry Bishop in custody.  Carole R. Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm   
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Pocan, Branch 26. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 27, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
